turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Im having kind of a bad day.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: I read somewhere that the suicide rate doubles during the holidays...

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: What am I saying?  You dont need to hear that...  All I meant was a lot of people have a hard time dealing with all the forced reverie, thats all.  Is that you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is it...?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Trouble at work?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I dont think so.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Its not Kate, is it?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: You see, its like were in each others heads...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Kates my wife...

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Look, you fit the profile exactly.  Thirties, house, kids, financial responsibilities.  You start thinking...this isnt the life I dreamt about.  Wheres the romance, wheres the joie de vivre?  Suddenly, every lingerie ad in the Newark Star Ledger represents a life you cant have...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Its just two kids, right?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Damn...

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Jesus, Jack, this is a league match, for gods sake!

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Wheres your follow through?  Wheres your stance?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hey, Im doing the best I can...  Id like to see you hit a squash ball after seventeen beers...

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Youre right.  Why am I so competitive!? Compensation, I guess. Look, just focus, Jack. You can still pick up the spare...

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Hey Jack, youre all flush.  I guess that seventy-one took a lot outta you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I just saw Evelyn Thompson.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: She is relentless.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She wants to have an affair with me.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: She said that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Pretty much.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Oh yeah...  What is it about you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So could you write down her exact address?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Whoa...whoa...wait a second, Jack.  Youre not actually gonna cheat on Kate?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It wouldnt really be cheating...  Its complicated.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Look, maybe Im not as good a consigliere as you are but you have to trust me on this one.  A little flirtations harmless but youre playing with fire here.  The Fidelity Bank and Trust is a tough creditor.  You make a deposit somewhere else, they close your account forever.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Im telling you, those rules dont apply to me, Arn.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Screw the rules.  Im talking about the choice.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Cmon, Evelyn Thompsons got no class.  She doesnt marry Dr. Steve, the womans living in a trailer.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hey, is that really necessary?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: All Im saying it there isnt a guy in Union County who wouldnt give his left nut to be married to Kate...

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: So Jack, its your wifes birthday, got anything to say to her?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Its your birthday? Today?  Whats your name?  Where were you born?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Hey, you cant park that thing here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Its me, Jack...

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: I dont care if youre Tim Allen with your fancy car and all your tools, you still cant park here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Tell me you recognize me, Arnie.  Please...

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Howd you know my name?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We bowl together. Were bowlers ...we won a championship...were winners.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: I never won anything in bowling.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Wait a second...  Jack...Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes...Jack Campbell...

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Of course. Jack Campbell. I went to high school with you...you played baseball, right?  Youre doing well...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes, thats it...yes, we went to high school together.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: You never really talked to me.  I wanted to talk to you, man...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah...I guess I just wanted you to know, we couldve been really good friends...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Wheres my car?!  Wheres my Ferrari!?

turns.speaker: BIG ED
turns.text: What the hell are you talking about?  Whats he talking about?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look, can I just borrow your car?!  I promise itll be returned!

turns.speaker: BIG ED
turns.text: The Caddy?  Why dont you take your own damn car!

turns.speaker: BIG ED
turns.text: Got a minute, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ive got all the time in the world...

turns.speaker: BIG ED
turns.text: Cmon Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I mean it.  From what I can tell, were a mom and pop operation, were already over-extended in sales, and any price advantage we could offer would easily be matched by a larger supplier...

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: DO YOU WANNA DIE?!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Yes you do...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look, I'm talking about a business deal here.  I buy the ticket for two hundred, take it to a store where the guy behind the counter...  ...doesn't have a death wish  ...I just made myself a quick thirty eight dollars.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Like I said, it's a business deal...

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Damn, you are the real thing...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How'd you know my name was Jack?

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: I call all you white guys "Jack."

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: You know you seem pretty relaxed for a guy who just had a gun pulled on him.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There's no way I was gonna die in that deli...  Let's just say I've been on a lucky streak lately.

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: A lucky streak, huh?

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: So you're telling me, you've got a gun to your head and you don't think for one second, what if this, what if that, maybe I shouldn't do this, I shoulda done that.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't do that.  That's just not for me...

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Okay, Jack.  Nice doing business with you... Cash is about to take off...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hey...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What do you want to carry that gun around for, anyway? You're just gonna do something you'll regret...

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: You want to talk about regrets, you're talking to the wrong person.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm just saying that you seem like a smart guy.  At a certain point you're gonna do something, and then there's no turning back...

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Yeah, in most cases that'd be true.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I mean there must be programs out there, opportunities...

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Wait a minute, wait a minute... you're tryin' to save me?

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Oh man, you're serious...  This man thinks I need to be saved!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Everyone needs something.

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Yeah?  What do you need?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: You just said everyone needs something.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I've got everything I need.

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Wow.  It must be great being you.  You got it all.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look, I'm not saying you'd be able to do it without some hard work...

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: You still think this is about me, don't you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sure it's about you.  But it's about society, too.

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Oh man, I'm gonna enjoy this one... Just remember, Jack, you did this.  You brought this on yourself...

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Miss me, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thats my car!  You stole my car!

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Its a callable asset seized in accordance with the acquisition by-laws of your alt-fate contract...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Basically, its my car now.  Get in.

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Might wanna fasten your seat belt, Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What the hell is happening to me?!

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Look, I dont know what youre getting so worked up about, you did this...you brought this on yourself.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Brought what on myself?! I didnt do anything!

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: No?  Cmon, Jack...Ive got everything I need, I dont have regrets, thats just not for me... sound familiar?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You mean because you thought I was cocky Im now on a permanent acid trip?!!

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Everyone else in that store is a statue, they see their lives passing in front of their eyes, but not you.  Youre making a business deal...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Give me my goddamn life back!

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: You?  What about me?  Im working hard for you here, Jack.  On Christmas too!  Now you did a good thing last night, intervening that way.  I was moved...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Please.  Just tell me whats happening to me. In plain English.  None of that mumbo jumbo...

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Its a glimpse, Jacko.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I glimpse?  A glimpse of what!?  What glimpse?! Glimpse!

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Look, eventually, everybody gets one...some of em take a couple seconds...  ...some of em take a lot longer...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I asked you a direct question!  A glimpse of what?!

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Figure it out.  You got plenty of time.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How much time?!

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: As long as it takes to figure it out.  Which, in your case, could be considerable.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look, I just want my life back.  Now whats it gonna take?  You wanna talk turkey?  Lets talk turkey!  How much money...?

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Do I look like I need your money.  It doesnt work like that and I cant tell you why.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Because you got to figure it out for yourself.  Are you listening to me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Figure it out?  Figure what out?!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thats it?  Thats all I get?!  A glare?!

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Look Jack, in my experience the best way people deal with this is to just relax and breathe through it...let it come to you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Whats this, a signal? Will you come whenever I ring it?

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Do I look like I live in a bottle?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But what do I do?

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Look Jack Im late.  Id love to help you out some more but I gotta go handle my business...  Happy trails.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You cant do this. You cant keep coming in and out of peoples lives, messing things up...

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: Cmon, Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ive got kids, Im going home...

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: You know what the word glimpse means, J? Its by nature an impermanent thing.

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: ...06...14...18...48...right there.  Four numbers...that's two hundred and thirty eight dollar...  Merry Christmas and shit...

turns.speaker: SAM WONG
turns.text: Ticket bad.  You draw in lines with pencil.

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: What're you talkin' about?

turns.speaker: SAM WONG
turns.text: You draw lines with pencil!  I know about this!

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: What!?  Look at the ticket...!

turns.speaker: SAM WONG
turns.text: Get out, I call 911.

turns.speaker: SAM WONG
turns.text: You leave now.  Take ticket somewhere else.  Next customer in line...!

turns.speaker: CASH
turns.text: You first generation, xenophobic, money-theistic, hot pastrami sandwich making...

turns.speaker: SAM WONG
turns.text: Get out!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Like the dress...?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Its lovely...

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I thought I saw you notice it at the kids recital.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Finger food...?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I dont think so, thank you...

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Cmon, as soon as I put them down, youre gonna grab a couple...you always do...

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Mushroom puffs arent the only thing I do well...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well do whatever it is you do well, and just...just do it. Excuse me...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Evelyn, right?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Very funny.  I saw you out there on lane five. What do you have the flu or something?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Something like that.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Need a nurse?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Youre a nurse?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Are we...?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Are we what, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is there something going on between us?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Are we finally being honest?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It would help me if we were.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Okay, youre right, weve been dancing around this for years...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm thinking I might walk tonight, Frank.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Nice night for it.  I'll have Louis send your car home.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Merry Christmas to you, sir...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thanks.  To you too...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa...hold it right there...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Frank.  Wheres Alan Mintz?  Is he here yet?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Mr. Mintz?  I dont think so...buildings closed pal.  Youll have to come back tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look, I dont know whats going on here but I am Senior Vice President of this company.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I dont care who you are.  Its Christmas and like I told you the building is closed.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Maybe youre not hearing me.  I am Jack Campbell...  Right here.  Jack Campbell, President...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do I have a private office somewhere in the building?

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Uh...sure Jack...  Right back there...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: ...I was the number one junior sales associate at E.F. Hutton in 1988.  Did you know that?

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: No, I didnt...thats great.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thats the kind of thing you can really build on...

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Uh huh...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I mean sales has always been a feeder for M and A, always...

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Here we are, mag wheels...  Hey Jack, are you sure youre okay?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, Im just a little confused right now about why I work here...

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Kates on two, Jack.  Nice ride...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If youre into that kind of conspicuous consumption...

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: You want me to handle him?  I think Im ready...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why dont you let me take this one, Kenny?

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Okay, chief.

turns.speaker: TONY THE DOORMAN
turns.text: Merry Christmas, Mr. Campbell.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Howd you do this year, Tony?

turns.speaker: TONY THE DOORMAN
turns.text: About four grand.  And a bottle of twenty five year old scotch from Mrs. Johnson in 9D.  Im putting it all in commercial paper like you said.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just until the Deutsche Mark turns...

turns.speaker: TONY THE DOORMAN
turns.text: Sorry, pal.  Entrance is for residents and guests only...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What are you talking about?  Its me, Jack Campbell.  Penthouse C. I put you into commercial paper!

turns.speaker: TONY THE DOORMAN
turns.text: Uh-huh...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Every one of these songs will remind you of me in a slightly different way...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: All in one tape?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I also put side two of London Calling on there...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I have a bad feeling about this.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: About the plane? What do you think its gonna crash? Dont say that...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I know weve talked about this a thousand times and we both agree that going to London is the right thing to do. But in my heart... this feels wrong.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Dont  go, Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You mean dont go at all? What about my internship?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Believe me I know what an incredible opportunity this is for you...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: For us, Kate.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Right, for us. But...Im afraid that if you get on that plane...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Go. Im sorry, you should just go...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, youre right.  What are we doing?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: We're being responsible.  Go. Get on the plane.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I can't seem to let go of you...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You hear me complaining about that?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah...fine.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What kind of man does that!?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I dont know!  Please stop yelling at me!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Where were you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I was in the city.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: The city?  New York City?  Why?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Because thats where I live.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Jack...dont even start...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look, you dont understand.  I woke up here...and this is very strange ...this is not my house...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Look, we dont have time for this right now, well talk about it later.  Now get dressed...  Youre not wearing that to the Thompsons party. I dont care how hilarious you think it is...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Party?  Oh no, I cant go to a party...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You look forward to this party all year.  Whats with you today?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Trust me on this Kate.  I really dont think going to a party is the right move for me at the present time.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Telling my mother she doesnt have to stay with the kids.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Because youll be here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Christ...  Where the hell is the bathroom?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Funny, Jack.  Im laughing on the inside.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes, Im fine.  Its just this god awful football phone!  Who has a phone like this anyway?!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Uh huh...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Pro bono.  You dont get paid at all.  Nobody makes a dime.  Well, bravo...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Here you go...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Youre kidding me...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Shes your dog, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, shes not.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Fine, shes the kids dog.  Lets go wake Josh, see if he wants to walk her.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But its twenty degrees outside...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Youre having a bad day, Ill go with you...actually, theres no way in hell youre gettin me back out there...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hello!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: ...my feet are hurtin...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: HEY!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uh...that babys crying...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: And...?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Jack.  I said the kids are asleep...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well thats just great...those little monkeys can be a real handful...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hey!  I was watching that!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I thought we had a deal about you watching CNBC in bed.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Im working on a new deal now...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Wait a second.  You want me, dont you?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: That is the general idea, yes...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Shouldnt we grab some dinner first?  Maybe a bottle of wine...?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Its ten thirty, Jack. By eleven youre gonna be sprawled out on the bed snoring your head off. We dont have time for wining and dining.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Whatever you say...honey.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Thanks, Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, Im serious...youre really stunning...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: This is good stuff, Jack, keep it coming...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I mean back in college, you were a very pretty girl, theres no question about that.  But this...  ...youve really grown into a beautiful woman...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: How can you do that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do what?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Look at me like you havent seen me every day for the last twelve years...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I mean...wow...off the charts great.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Its an unbelievable thing.  Wearing this suit actually makes me feel like a better person.  Im gonna buy it...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: $2,400?!  Are you out of your mind?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She got those shoes...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Those shoes were twenty five dollars.  Cmon, take it off.  Well go to the food court and get one of those funnel cakes you like.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do you have any idea what my life is like?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I wake up in the morning covered in dog saliva...I drop the kids off, spend eight hours selling tires retail...retail, Kate.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I pick up the kids, walk the dog, which by the way, carries the added bonus of carting away her monstrous crap...I play with the kids, take out the garbage, get six hours of sleep if Im lucky, and then it starts all over again...and why is it that I always have to drive everyone everywhere?  I spend practically my entire day in that slow as hell mini-van listening to Raffi tapes and trying to figure out how the cup holders work...Im sick of it.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Whats in it for me? Where are my Mary Janes?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Its sad to hear your life is such a disappointment to you, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I cant believe its not a disappointment to you!  Jesus, Kate, I couldve been a thousand times the man I became.  How could you do this to me?  How could you let me give up on my dreams like this?!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look, Im sorry.  Im sorry I was such a saint before and Im such a prick now.  Maybe Im just not the same guy I was when we got married...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Maybe youre not.  The Jack Campbell I married wouldnt need a $2400 suit to make himself feel better about his life, but if thats what its gonna take, then buy it. Just buy the goddamn suit ...we can take the money out of the kids college fund.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Well...Annie for one.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Surprise.  Were pregnant...  Yeah...that mustve been...I mean that was very unexpected.  But what are you gonna do, right?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I think it worked out okay, dont you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sure.  I really like Annie.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Good, Jack.  Maybe well keep her.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, I love Annie.  We had a lot of good times, didnt we?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: We were young...  Remember that little place on Charles Street we used to go to?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Charles Street?  In the Village?  When we were living in Greenwich Village...?  Great times.  Whyd we ever leave?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You cant really raise a kid in an apartment in the Village...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: The trek out to the hospital every day didnt help either...  You were great. Surviving the heart attack was one thing...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You had a heart attack?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Jack, stop that. I'm still mad at you...  ...who knows what wouldve happened if you hadnt stepped in at the store.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thats why I work for Big Ed?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Our life in a nutshell...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: If you want to look at it that way...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How would you look at it?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: How was the game, honey?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Long, boring, and generally pretty sad. Arnie seemed to enjoy it...  Hey, wheres that chocolate cake...?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You mean this chocolate cake?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thats my piece.  I was saving it because I got nauseated from that store bought chicken.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Cmon.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Sorry, Jack.  Its too important to me.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You want the cake!?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I want it...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thank you...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Its good, right?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Say it, Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What...?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Cmon, you know what I like to hear...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, baby, I know what you like to hear...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Then say it...just say it to me...!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh yeah, youre a bad girl, baby... You make me so hot...Im gonna take you to that special place...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not it...?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Nice, Jack.  Youre sweeping me off my feet.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What? You make me hot...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Wait a minute.  Youre my wife?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Maybe I should wait...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: No, open it...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I found it at an outlet store.  I know its a knock-off, but I think itll look great on you...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Zeena...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You really are incredible...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Enjoy it, sweetheart...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Heres the thing.  I really hadnt planned on giving you your...uh... anniversary gift until tonight.  You know, anniversarys good all day...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What are you talking about?  You never wait all day.  You can barely wait until its light out.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I know that, but...
